trans-unit.source: Represents the format to view an email message.
Use the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView> class to specify copies of an e-mail message in different formats.
For example, if you send a message in HTML, you might also want provide a plain text version in case some of the recipients use e-mail readers that cannot display HTML content.

This class has two properties <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView.LinkedResources%2A> and <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView.BaseUri%2A> that are used to resolve URLs within the content of the email.
<xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView.LinkedResources%2A> is a collection of <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResource> objects.

When rendered, URLs within the e-mail's content are first matched against the URLs in the <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResource.ContentLink%2A> of each <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResource> object in the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView.LinkedResources%2A> collection, and resolved.

<xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView.BaseUri%2A> is used by the mail reader to resolve relative URLs within the body, and also to resolve relative <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResource.ContentLink%2A> URLs, in the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView.LinkedResources%2A> collection.
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AlternateView"></xref> with the specified <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
A new instance of the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView> class call also be initialized by calling one of the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView.CreateAlternateViewFromString%2A> methods.
A stream that contains the content for this view.
contentStream is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AlternateView"></xref> with the specified file name.
A new instance of the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView> class call also be initialized by calling one of the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView.CreateAlternateViewFromString%2A> methods.
The name of the file that contains the content for this alternate view.
fileName is `null`.
The caller does not have the required permission.
An I/O error occurred, such as a disk error.
The access requested is not permitted by the operating system for the specified file handle, such as when access is Write or ReadWrite and the file handle is set for read-only access.
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AlternateView"></xref> with the specified <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> and <xref href="System.Net.Mime.ContentType"></xref>.
A new instance of the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView> class call also be initialized by calling one of the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView.CreateAlternateViewFromString%2A> methods.
A stream that contains the content for this attachment.
The type of the content.
contentStream is `null`.
contentType is not a valid value.
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AlternateView"></xref> with the specified <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> and media type.
A new instance of the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView> class call also be initialized by calling one of the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView.CreateAlternateViewFromString%2A> methods.
A stream that contains the content for this attachment.
The MIME media type of the content.
contentStream is `null`.
mediaType is not a valid value.
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AlternateView"></xref> with the specified file name and content type.
A new instance of the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView> class call also be initialized by calling one of the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView.CreateAlternateViewFromString%2A> methods.
The name of the file that contains the content for this alternate view.
The type of the content.

contentType is not a valid value.

An I/O error occurred, such as a disk error.
The access requested is not permitted by the operating system for the specified file handle, such as when access is Write or ReadWrite and the file handle is set for read-only access.
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AlternateView"></xref> with the specified file name and media type.
A new instance of the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView> class call also be initialized by calling one of the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView.CreateAlternateViewFromString%2A> methods.
The name of the file that contains the content for this alternate view.
The MIME media type of the content.
fileName is `null`.
mediaType is not a valid value.

An I/O error occurred, such as a disk error.
The access requested is not permitted by the operating system for the specified file handle, such as when access is Write or ReadWrite and the file handle is set for read-only access.
Gets or sets the base URI to use for resolving relative URIs in the <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AlternateView"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Uri"></xref>.
The base <xref href="System.Uri"></xref>.
Creates a <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AlternateView"></xref> of an email message using the content specified in a <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
The default media type is plain text and the default encoding is ASCII.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the content of the email message.
An <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AlternateView"></xref> object that represents an alternate view of an email message.
content is null.
Creates an <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AlternateView"></xref> of an email message using the content specified in a <xref href="System.String"></xref> and the specified MIME media type of the content.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the content for this attachment.
A that describes the data in string.
An <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AlternateView"></xref> object that represents an alternate view of an email message.
content is null.

Creates an <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AlternateView"></xref> of an email message using the content specified in a <xref href="System.String"></xref>, the specified text encoding, and MIME media type of the content.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the content for this attachment.
The MIME media type of the content.
An <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AlternateView"></xref> object that represents an alternate view of an email message.
content is null.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AlternateView"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets the set of embedded resources referred to by this attachment.
A <xref href="System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection"></xref> object that stores the collection of linked resources to be sent as part of an e-mail message.
